intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: No fair playing the martyr! Nobody made me go with you. I left of my own free will! I’m ready to accept my punishment, too! Wait, what am I saying?

intro.speaker: Rhys
intro.line: Please, Commander Greil! Titania entrusted me with her orders. If anyone’s to blame for this mess, it’s me. I’m the one who should be punished...

intro.speaker: Oscar
intro.line: I set a poor example, Commander Greil. Any punishment should be mine alone.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Regardless of your reasons, you disobeyed the orders of a superior officer. You are confined to quarters for ten days.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: But, Father! They did what they did to help me and Rolf!

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Rules exist for a reason, Mist. Men won’t survive on a battlefield if they do as the, wish without so much as a by-your-leave.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: That being said, we’ve got more work than we can handle. Your punishment is deferred until things calm down.

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: I’m pleased to see that you are willing to shield one another. However...

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Oscar, Boyd, Rhys. You come with me.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Shinon, Gatrie, and you, Ike. You’re with me.

intro.speaker: Havetti
intro.line: Yar har ho! Me belly’s emptier ‘n me first mate’s head! Fetch me some grub!

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Are you all ready? Greil Mercenaries, move out!

battle.speaker: Marcia
battle.line: Hey! You! Boat monkey! You tricked me, didn’t you?

battle.speaker: Havetti
battle.line: Tricked ye? What a vile and nasty thing that is to be sayin’. Don’t ye agree, matey?

battle.speaker: Pirate
battle.line: Yar, that I do! There be nothing but honest pirates aboard this ship, missy.

battle.speaker: Marcia
battle.line: You said you knew the whereabouts of my older brother. That’s why I came all the way to your ship.

battle.speaker: Havetti
battle.line: Aye, and we do know! He was on board for a while, and then...Do ye recall where he went, matey?

battle.speaker: Pirate
battle.line: Yar, that I do. He was a penniless oaf, so we tossed his worthless carcass into the rolling waves. Yar har ho!

battle.speaker: Pirate
battle.line: Horrid? Did ye say horrid? Yer scurvy brother was the horrid one! He lost a game o’ chance, he did. If ye lose, ye must pay...And the scallywag tried to cheat me! By Shanty Pete he did!

battle.speaker: Havetti
battle.line: After all, his darling sister’s come to pay us a visit. What say ye work off yer brother’s debt?

battle.speaker: Marcia
battle.line: What say I run you through with my lance and call it a day?!

battle.speaker: Pirate
battle.line: Yo ho har! It matters not that ye be a pegasus knight, lassie.

battle.speaker: Havetti
battle.line: A wee minnow like yerself is no match for us sea dogs! Prepare yourself, ye flying wench!

battle.speaker: Marcia
battle.line: Pfff! I’m not afraid of you, clambake! If your axe is as dull as your wit,this will be over in no time!

visit.speaker: Nasir
visit.line: This town seems quite unruly, wouldn’t you say? Is it always this dangerous? Oh...So it’s plagued by pirates, is it? I see. That would explain why the people here seem so anxious. You seem so very...young. And you claim you were hired to rid the town of these pesky pirates? Here, perhaps you should take this. It might help you if you run into trouble contending with the pirates. But do hurry. I came all this way to see the world-famous fish market, and I’ll never do so with those ruffians around. Best of luck to you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Marcia
recruit-talk.line: Oh, crackers! There’s too many of them. I don’t want to die here...Brother...this might be the end!

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: I’m a mercenary. The villagers hired us to get rid of these pirates.

recruit-talk.speaker: Marcia
recruit-talk.line: Are you...Are you going to help me?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: Of course. Let me and my companions take it from here. You can escape while the pirates are distracted.

recruit-talk.speaker: Marcia
recruit-talk.line: Oh, hey, that would be fantastic! Thanks so much! I don’t know what to say.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: You don’t have to say anything. It’s all in a day’s work.

recruit-talk.speaker: Marcia
recruit-talk.line: Pshaw! You’re helping me out! I should show my gratitude somehow.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: That’s...nice, but I can’t think of anything off the top of my head. Just get yourself somewhere safe, please.

recruit-talk.speaker: Marcia
recruit-talk.line: Well then...I’ll come talk to you about repaying my debt later. What’s your name, handsome?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: Um... I’m Ike. I’m with the Greil Mercenaries.

recruit-talk.speaker: Marcia
recruit-talk.line: Ike! Got it! And I am Marcia, a pegasus knight of Begnion. Don’t forget me! All right, I’ll be seeing you later!

character-falls.speaker: Marcia
character-falls.line: Urrr... Ah, nuts...Bro-Brother...I’ll be with you soon.

boss.speaker: Havetti
boss.line: Yahar har harrr! Yer bustin’ me gut, ye rudderless fool! Do ya truly think ye can face me mighty axe and live?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: We’ve driven off all the pirates. Your people will suffer no more indignities at their hands.

end.speaker: Mayor
end.line: Oh! That is joyful news! Here is your pay, as promised.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Thank you very much. And if you find yourself in need again, do not hesitate to send word.

end.speaker: Mayor
end.line: Of course, of course. All of you put on a most marvelous show–such combat skills! To be honest,I was expecting Commander Greil to be here today. When I saw just you, nothing more than, no offense, a band of children...Well, I will admit to being a tad nervous!

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: I apologize for troubling you. Unfortunately, Commander Greil had other pressing matters to attend to.

end.speaker: Mayor
end.line: Oh, no. Don’t apologize. There’s no need. After all, you got rid of those brigands, and you did it impeccably well!

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: It’s a fine compliment you pay, sir, but it was our pleasure.

end.speaker: Mayor
end.line: As a matter of fact, you’re more than good enough to be in the royal army if you so desired. Especially your Commander Greil. He’s far and away better than most any general I’ve seen hereabouts. Er... What I mean to say is...Don’t you think running off pirates is a bit...beneath you?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: That’s not–

end.speaker: Mayor
end.line: Don’t get me wrong, now. You certainly helped all of us simple folk out. Even so, it seems to me the proper place for you and your Commander Greil is in the service of the Crimean throne! Well, that’s what this old man thinks.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: We–and Commander Greil–are quite satisfied with the work we do now.

end.speaker: Mayor
end.line: You’ve nary a selfish bone among you. Well then, rest assured we’ll speak again if any problems arise. Thank you again.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Hmm...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Titania? Is something amiss?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: No, of course not. Our mission is complete, and that’s all that matters. You did well today, every one of you.

end.speaker: Shinon
end.line: Pah! Jobs like this barely make a dent in my incurable boredom! It’s like that old buzzard said, there’s better work out there Something with a bit of challenge.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Shinon!

end.speaker: Shinon
end.line: I’m joking. J-O-K-ing.

end.speaker: Gatrie
end.line: Come, Titania. Be honest. Don’t you find the work we do to be a bit...disheartening? Unglamorous?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: What? You too, Gatrie? What’s gotten into you?

end.speaker: Gatrie
end.line: Please! Look, we’re not a band of money-hungry recruits. We’re professionals, and we’re very good at what we do. Shinon and I have discussed this at length. All of this mundane mercenary work is unworthy of us. We’re wasting our talents.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: I see. You’re telling me that you think Commander Greil is mismanaging us. Do I have that right?

end.speaker: Gatrie
end.line: Whoa! Hold it right there! That’s not what I’m saying at all!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What is it, Titania?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: What’s what?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You seem so angry. It’s not like you.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Hmph...

end.speaker: Gatrie
end.line: Exactly! Ike’s got the right of it!

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: It’s just that I...Look, we do good work, and we help people. I want you to be proud of that. I felt like you were saying work that doesn’t bring fame and fortune isn’t worth doing, that’s all. Sorry.

end.speaker: Gatrie
end.line: No...you’re right. We are the ones who ought to apologize.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Enough. Let’s get going, shall we? Rest is part of our jobs, too. We can’t go into the next battle exhausted.

end.speaker: Gatrie
end.line: Now that’s a plan! I’m so hungry, I could eat a wyvern!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Titania!

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: What is it?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: If you’re looking for pride...I have it.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Hm?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You and my father have kept this mercenary group together. And I’m...just...proud to be a part of it. That’s all.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Ike...

end.speaker: Shinon
end.line: Pah. I’m surrounded by idealistic fools. What’s so wrong with fame? What’s wrong with having money to live well?
